title: Several spells of showers expected in parts of the island
byline: Several spells of showers will occur in Northern and Eastern provinces and in Anuradhapura district, the Department of Meteorology says.

title: French government collapses in no-confidence vote
byline: The French government has collapsed after Prime Minister Michel Barnier was ousted in a no-confidence vote.

title: Vote on Account to be presented in Parliament today
byline: The Vote on Account for the first 04 months of the year 2025, including government recurrent and capital expenditure, public debt servicing and debt restructuring expenses is scheduled to be presented to Parliament today (05).

title: 23-year-old woman clubbed to death in Ketawala
byline: A young woman has been clubbed to death by a person in the Ketawala area of Siripagama police division.

title: Final decision on NDF’s National List MP seat to be announced tomorrow
byline: Member of Parliament Rohitha Abeygunawardena has stated that the final decision regarding the remaining National List MP seat of the New Democratic Front (NDF) will be revealed tomorrow (06).

title: SLPP’s Administrative Secretary Renuka Perera arrested
byline: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) Administrative Secretary Renuka Perera has been arrested by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) for allegedly posting false information on ‘Mahaviru’ commemorations in the North through social media, police said.

title: Revised terms of IMF agreement to be included in upcoming Budget
byline: The Leader of the House Minister Bimal Rathnayake stated that the revised terms of the agreement reached with the International Monetary Fund (IMF) will be included in the upcoming Budget.

title: Debate on Vote on Account begins in Parliament
byline: The Vote on Account for the first four months of the year 2025, including government recurrent and capital expenditure, public debt servicing and debt restructuring expenses has been presented to Parliament today (05).

title: US Assistant Secretary of State Donald Lu visits Sri Lanka
byline: The United States Assistant Secretary of State for the Bureau of South and Central Asian Affairs, Donald Lu, has arrived in Sri Lanka today (05) as part of an official delegation.

title: Special audit on electric vehicle imports for expat workers
byline: A special audit has been carried out on the scheme introduced to import fully electric vehicles for expatriate workers.

title: Petition against National Olympic Committee’s Secretary General deferred
byline: The Colombo District Court today (05) ordered that the petition seeking an injunction to suspend the activities of the Secretary General of the National Olympic Committee of Sri Lanka, Maxwell De Silva, be recalled on December 18.

title: 14 Indian fishermen arrested for poaching in Sri Lankan waters
byline: A special operation conducted by the Sri Lanka Navy has led to the seizure of two Indian fishing boats and the apprehension of 14 Indian fishermen, poaching in Sri Lankan waters.

title: World Bank pledges support for govt’s “Clean Sri Lanka” programme
byline: The World Bank has expressed its commitment to supporting the Government of Sri Lanka’s “Clean Sri Lanka” programme, as announced by World Bank Executive Director Parameswaran Iyer during a meeting with President Anura Kumara Dissanayake at the Presidential Secretariat yesterday (04).

title: Sri Lanka to ink debt deals by year’s end - Minister
byline: Sri Lanka vowed Thursday to complete its long-delayed foreign debt restructure within the month before a 2025 budget adhering to strict revenue targets set by the International Monetary Fund.

title: Lohan Ratwatte and wife granted bail
byline: Former State Minister Lohan Ratwatte and his wife Shashi Prabha Ratwatte have been granted bail today (05) by the Nugegoda Magistrate’s Court.

title: Govt. allocates nearly Rs. 1,402 billion through Vote on Account
byline: The government has presented an interim Vote on Account for the initial four months of 2025, allocating close to Rs. 1,402 billion for maintaining state affairs and continuing ongoing projects.

title: 10 students stranded in Hanthana mountain range rescued
byline: The Sri Lanka Army says that a group of 10 students from a leading school in Colombo, who were stranded while trekking in the Hanthana mountain range, have been rescued by army troops.

title: SLPP’s Administrative Secretary Renuka Perera granted bail
byline: The Administrative Secretary of the Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) Renuka Perera has been released on bail by the Colombo Magistrate’s Court.

title: Amnesty International report says Israel is committing genocide in Gaza
byline: Amnesty International on Thursday accused Israel of “committing genocide“ against Palestinians in Gaza since the start of the war last year, saying its new report was a “wake-up call” for the international community.

title: 55 vulnerable Sri Lankans evacuated from Lebanon
byline: The Embassy of Sri Lanka in Lebanon in association with the International Organization of Migration (IOM) has arranged to evacuate a total number of 55 vulnerable Sri Lankan workers from Lebanon on group basis.
